title: Angular
content: It is one of the most powerful, efficient, and open-source JS frameworks. Google operates it, and developers implement it for developing a Single Page Application (SPA).
author: Google

title: Vue.JS
content: Developed in 2016, Vue.JS has effectively made its way into the market and proved its worth by offering diverse features
author: Evan You

title: React
content: Facebook created the React framework, and it has earned popularity within a short duration. Developers use it to create and operate the dynamic User Interface of the web pages with high incoming traffic.
author: Facebook

title: Meteor
content: Meteor serves the larger portion of the software development. It is majorly used in backend development, management of the database, business logic and rendering of the front-end part of the websites.
author: Ossama ATTALIB

title: Ember.js
content: Ember.js hit the market in 2015 and gained immense popularity with its wide application area. Its features support two-way data binding, thereby building a reliable platform for managing the complicated User Interfaces
author: Ossama ATTALIB

title: Node.js
content: It is open-source and a server-side JavaScript run-time environment, which works on cross platforms. This framework has the capability of managing asynchronous I/O with its event-driven architecture
author: Ossama ATTALIB
